alert.note: Alert for Colorado; Inland Jackson; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 4:50AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Colorado, northwestern Wharton and northwestern Jackson Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 450 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Speaks, or 17 miles southeast of Hallettsville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Eagle Lake, Sheridan, Altair, Nada, Garwood and Rock Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern Texas.
